double_jeopardy_round: ALFRED NOBEL, THIS IS YOUR LIFE

(1, 1).clue: (I'm Lee Goldberg from New York's ABC7.) In the 1800s Brooklyn's Plymouth Church became known as the "the Grand Central depot" of this secretive network that helped slaves escape to the North

(2, 1).clue: A triptych by painter Francis Bacon inspired the chest-bursting scene from this 1979 film

(3, 1).clue: Recipients kneel on a special footstool before Queen Elizabeth to be dubbed a dame or this male equivalent

(4, 1).clue: A rising political star, he became grand sachem of Tammany Hall in 1868, making him a true "Boss"

(1, 2).clue: (I'm Bill Ritter from New York's ABC7.) I'm in Flushing Meadows in Queens & the towers behind me were part of the New York State pavilion at this 1964  celebration

(2, 2).clue: The structures in Larry Niven's novel "Ringworld" inspired this video game series with a more angelic ring in the title

(3, 2).clue: Here's Leonardo's version of the Annunciation, with this angel kneeling before the Virgin Mary

(1, 3).clue: (I'm Sade Baderinwa from New York's ABC7.) On the way to Staten Island from Manhattan you can see this island where the American lives of many U.S. families began

(2, 3).clue: A 1984 joke about a fake show called "Miami Nice" was the inspiration for this Bea Arthur / Betty White sitcom

(3, 3).clue: This 49ers QB took a knee as his protest during the national anthem at the suggestion of ex-Seahawk & Green Beret Nate Boyer

(4, 3).clue: Though Eli Whitney secured a patent for this invention in 1794, the ease of its piracy put the man out of business

(6, 3).clue: The logical reasons why an action was taken

(1, 4).clue: (I'm Liz Cho from New York's ABC7.) Ulysses S. Grant & his wife Julia lie together in Grant's Tomb in upper Manhattan; it is said their desire to be interred side by side stemmed from a visit to the tomb of this Spanish royal couple

(2, 4).clue: Artwork for the Elton John song "I've Seen That Movie Too" inspired this mocking cable TV show that premiered in 1988

(3, 4).clue: With feet of clay, a member of this spirit army takes a knee to protect Emperor Shihuangdi

(4, 4).clue: Behind Gandhi is a throng of supporters in the symbolic march to the sea in 1930 to collect this

(6, 4).clue: Area of dense shrubs often found in southern California

(1, 5).clue: (I'm Ryan Field from New York's ABC7.) The High Line Park runs from the Meatpacking District through Chelsea to New York City's convention center, named for this late senator

(2, 5).clue: A very optimistic sermon by Father Divine led Johnny Mercer to write this classic 1944 song

(4, 5).clue: It was the winning 1-word slogan of the Afrikaner National Party in 1948

(6, 5).clue: High-level programming language used for teaching

(1, 1).clue: Seen here is an engraving of this god & his eponymous pipe

(2, 1).clue: When it precedes "case of" or "incident of" in titles, this word means provokingly strange, not inquisitive

(3, 1).clue: Alfred's will lays out his prizes, specifying that one is for holding these congresses & reducing standing armies

(4, 1).clue: The covenant creating this league in 1919 mentions the goal "to promote international cooperation"

(5, 1).clue: The film "What's New Pussycat?", about a guy women chase, had a title song by this guy women chased

(6, 1).clue: This Man in Black of country music wrote "The Man in White" about St. Paul & Jesus

(2, 2).clue: Monster of the Oedipus myth used to describe an inscrutable person

(3, 2).clue: In 1863 Nobel patented this innovative "cap", a detonator for triggering explosives

(4, 2).clue: The NCL, or "National" these people's "League", works for economic justice for shoppers

(5, 2).clue: Phoebe on "Friends" was known to warble about this feline

(6, 2).clue: "The Dolorous Passion of Our Lord Jesus Christ" by Anne Emmerich inspired a 2004 movie from this director

(2, 3).clue: A subterranean chamber adds "IC" at the end to be this word meaning ambiguous

(3, 3).clue: A turning point was when this type of newspaper article was published in error & Alfred was shocked by how he'd be remembered

(4, 3).clue: Hiawatha is traditionally credited as one of the founders of this league of 5, then 6 nations

(5, 3).clue: The feline in this Harry Chapin song was accompanied by "Little Boy Blue and the Man in the Moon"

(6, 3).clue: "The Gospel According to" this "Myra Breckinridge" author moves the crucifixion to the television age

(1, 4).clue: The blowpipe & dart seen here are from Sarawak on the Malaysian part of this island

(2, 4).clue: Enciphering machine built by Germany--can you break its code?

(3, 4).clue: Early in his career, a factory Alfred had built to produce this liquid explosive blew up, killing his brother Emil

(4, 4).clue: In the 19th century the Land League on this island sought to gain more rights from their British landlords

(5, 4).clue: This quartet sang "Our house is a very very very fine house, with two cats in the yard, life used to be so hard"

(6, 4).clue: The Greek Orthodox church tried & failed to excommunicate Nikos Kazantzakis for writing this 1955 novel

(1, 5).clue: These are your standard PVC pipes--PVC short for this

(2, 5).clue: O say can you "C" this puzzling word that may involve puns? Oh, it's a...

(3, 5).clue: An ailing Alfred died in this Italian city then known for "San"atoria & now for a music festival

(4, 5).clue: "Defenders of soil, air, woods, waters & wildlife" is the compleat motto of the league named for this 17th c. Brit

(5, 5).clue: Members of The Cure wore kitty costumes in the video for this poppy tune, the band's first U.K. Top 10 hit

(6, 5).clue: This title item of Jesus' clothing is won by a Roman soldier in a dice game in a Lloyd Douglas novel

(0, 0).clue: This show has songs that weren't in the 1992 film it's based on, like "I Wanna Dance With Somebody" & "How Will I Know"
